Reviews.Title: “Average hotel right beside metro”
Reviews.Author: PeepsRyan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Orazia for two nights (weekend) recently. As mentioned in previous reviews, the hotel is on the 5th floor of the building, reachable by a nice old-fashioned lift. The hotel itself is quite small. It is an old building but the rooms were clean. Functional, but clean. Despite being away for our anniversary in Italy, this hotel didn't inspire much romance in us I am afraid to say! You could easily hear the neighbours next door arguing and talking. I'm not sure of the regular prices of the hotel in off season but we suspect our rates were hiked up due to the Rome Marathon which took place during our stay (which we didn't know about prior to arrival, our bad). We noticed some of the staff speak little English and on one of the mornings, I had to go out with creased clothes as the guy on reception didn't understand that we were looking for the loan of the house iron! The breakfast was fine, nothing to write home about but fine. It's very close to the metro and ideal for sightseeing if you don't have time to walk everywhere or have mobility issues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but bad employee”
Reviews.Author: Susanamoreira
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel 2 nights and I enjoy it. The room was clean, the breakfest was delicious a nd is very near of the metro station. The only bad experience was with one employee, that was working at 4am, and it was the worst person that I find in this trip to Italy. I made the check-out, and in my reservation was writted that I was free from any tax, but he forced me to pay 16€. Even when I show him the reservation, his answer was that nobody had told him anything. The only reason because I paid it was because I have to catch a plain! If you stay in this Hotel, do the check out in the day before you leave, is just an advice....in my opinion this type of situation are very profit for that particulary person, do know what I mean?

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Marianne K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with mother and cousin for 7 nights. Staff nice and friendly. Breakfast good and plentiful. Bathroom could use a bit of a face lift but otherwise clean. Charming old world lift to get up to the 5th floor where the Hotel is. Shops close by and metro around the corner and most places of interest within walking distance. Recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very well located”
Reviews.Author: fadixxx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good, clean and well located The staff is helpful, friendly and smiling. The rooms are small but clean with attached toilet and standing shower The location is excellent, in the middle of room at steps away from the metro and the train terminal and 7 minuts walking to coloseum and other attraction I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Redster1
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, this 3 star hotel was real value for money. The staff were friendly, the room was a quadruple with a large queen size bed and 2 single beds. Comfy and very clean. Bathroom en-suite was large with enough towels and very clean. Typical european style, it is an old hotel with older furnishings. But it was very comfortable, the little bay window added a great finish to the room and it overlooks the park. We were close to the sites of Rome and a 5 minute walk to the train station. There is a metro stop right at the hotel, so an excellent location. Breakfast was good and fresh. Just the juice is made from a machine and powdered. Other than that, all was fab. The lift is a bit old but it works. As a family, we were very happy to stay there and would return again if we were in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, lobby on 5th floor.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa19791983
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Adequate room. If small elevator is being used, it's 5 flights of stairs to the lobby. Breakfast was OK.

Reviews.Title: “We expect more that we find”
Reviews.Author: CristinaGeorgescu
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean room and friendly staff but that`s all. The room it was very small, for our family ( 2 adults and 2 kids) with no carpets on the floor, with no decorations on the wall, no remote for TV and no internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: IrishRover31
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stayed in this hotel, which as already be mentioned is in a great location for sightseeing with the Metro just outside the hotel and within easy walking distance of the Colesseum. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room I stayed in was very clean and even though it was a single room it still had a double bed which was nice. Would have been nice to have had tea/coffee making facilities in the room especially after a long day of sightseeing and walking ! Some good restaurants in the area which are more reasonably priced than in the tourist areas. I ate a couple of times at the Venecchi Cona ( not sure if this the the correct name but something similar) which is just a few streets away from the hotel. I had no problem with the lift and thought it had old fashioned charm. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet and friendly hotel in a good location - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: HighlanderGav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights - a couple + 2 children (10 and 14). The room was spacious, quiet (we slept like logs!), very clean and we were able to check in early which was great. The only downside of the room was the 10ft high wardrobes that required a pole to hang your clothes, a couple of cracked tiles and a slightly leaky shower screen (all minor and have seen worse in 5* hotels). People have complained about the lift to the 5th floor but we thought it charming and gave it an authentic Agatha Christie feel. Being a small hotel, it felt more personal than the larger hotels and yet we never felt cramped. The staff were always friendly, courteous and very helpful. Breakfast was a continental mix of cold meat, cheese, pastries, bread, juices and a great coffee machine. As there are no tea/coffee facilities in the room, it would be good if the hotel kept the machine on all day. The location was very good - 2 mins walk to the underground, near all the buses and trams, 10 min walk to the Colosseum and plenty of restaurants nearby. There is also a great little supermarket 2 mins along the road where you can stock up with fresh bread, freshly cut Italian hams, drinks etc for your picnics. We would definitely use this hotel again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Hotel, added value to the price”
Reviews.Author: Ofer777
Reviews.Content: No Wi-Fi at room, only in the lobby. The Hotel staff courteous and polite, and give a good feeling. The Hotel reception placed on floor 5, and the elevator smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: LeePompanobeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in Jan. Three days before our cruise and 6 days after. We arrived early and while our room was being made up we were offered the breakfast which had a good assortment. It changed slightly each morning. It was a cold buffet but more then what we has expected. A coppuccio machine and coffee was wonderful to have. When we came out of the subway the hotel was across the park. The train station was about a 5-10 minute walk. The train for the airport was at that end of the track. There were several good restaurants in the area. I do not remember the Italian name but the english name would be White Horse that was very good and not too expensive.The hotel staff was excellent particularly the manager. Clean and lots of towels. We were sick coming off the cruise so we were quite relieved to return to this hotel. Buses and trams were very close by. We found the electric buses very good for viewing Rome. We bought the day passes The area is a busy one with a mixed ethic groups but we always felt safe. An inexpensive hotel with an European open elevator. Reception on the 5 th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Warm, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TWisdom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful. Do not be fooled by the exterior, the inside is very clean, very tastefully decorated, and comfortable. The staff are professional, welcoming, and very accommodating. We had actually come to this hotel because the hotel we were staying at previously had so frustrated us with their awful service that we simply left, forfeiting one night of hotel fees. At any rate, we are extremely satisfied with this hotel. It is good value for money, unbelievably cheap for the accommodations and service provided.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the negative reviews. It's a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mightymousenicole
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orazia for a week. The staff was very friendly. They made reservations for us, gave us travel advice, and spoke English very well. The room was clean and updated and large enough for the two of us. Yes, the TV and air conditioner were small, but that is typical for non-American. The breakfast was also an Italian breakfast (croissants, rolls, yogurt, cereal, fruit, coffee, tea, juice, etc), but filled us up well each day. Some reviewers have complained about the location. We loved how close it was to the sites and walked to almost everything. The park nearby does have some graffiti and the occasional urine smell, but this was common every where we we went in Rome. We never felt unsafe, even when returning around midnight. The elevator always worked, although it is small and slow. The only complaint is that the shower was small and drained slow, however we never bothered to tell the staff about the drainage problem.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: hjhaas85
Reviews.Content: We saw the photos on the website and they looked nice. So when we got to the hotel, we were very let down. The area that the hotel is located is very dirty, a lot of immigrants in this area, we did not feel very safe walking the streets at night. The hotel is located on the 5th floor and has a lot of steps but offers a very old small elevator. At first the desk clerk was not at the desk so we had to ask the cleaning lady to find him. He came to the desk and was not very friendly. He put us in a very small room with 2 double beds pushed together. The view was terrible, overlooking other people apartments and a business right out the window. We immediately asked for a bigger room since we would be staying for 6 nights. He told us the next day we could switch. So he put us in a bigger room. The room had a queen sized bed that was very hard with hard pillows, a bigger bathroom with a bathtub but no shower curtain. My European hair dryer wouldn't fit into the plugs so I had to use the 1960's hair dryer that was on the wall. We had a small tv with only 1 English speaking channel (CNN) which we already expected living in Europe for 4 years. The view from this room was a little better. It was overlooking a big park which we could see the bums sleeping in at night and where people were shooting fire crackers off randomly throughout the night. The walls are very, very thin. Each night I could hear the people in the rooms next to us talking and watching their televisions. I had a very hard time sleeping. I could hear people as they walked down the hall past our room talking and just walking! The pros to this hotel were that it is right by the metro. Very easy access. There was one great Italian Restaurant that the clerk directed us to right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good location”
Reviews.Author: 17_down_186_to_go
Reviews.Content: We were on a budget for the one night we were stopping in Rome so I decided to stay here. When we walked up from the Metro steps, we immediately questioned our decision. We felt particularly unsafe when we buzzed to get in when we got back from dinner and there is a shady character lurking right behind us. We quickly scooted in the door and slammed the door behind us. The lift is very tiny. There were only two of us with backpacks and it felt like we were testing the limits of space and weight. The reception stuff wasn't very helpful and welcoming in the rooms were spacious. But we were still glad that we only had to stay there for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Orazia, A good find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mgmatz
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 2 week trip to italy and Hotel Orazia was our first stay. It suited our needs ( 2 couples traveling together) as we wanted a clean, safe hotel for under 150 euros per night . It was easy to walk to the Colliseum and was also close to a train stop. We never felt unsafe in the surrounding neighborhood and would recommend this hotel to others seeking a moderately priced place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: paulh020
Reviews.Content: There was four of us staying here for the weekend to catch an Italy Serie A football match. We booked the room online due to the positive reviews we had read and we were not to be disappointed. A 10 minute walk from the Termini station, the hotel was easy to find and seemed to be in a busy shopping area of the city. Although the lift looks daunting, it was a much better option than to try and walk the 5 flights of stairs tothe reception. The rooms themselves were very clean and spacious. Our 4 bed room was more than adequate for what we wanted and thought it was a bargain for the 240e we paid for 2 nights. Come the nighttime the area quietens down, there are lots of restaurants within 5 mins walking distance and a couple of bars scattered around although it was a god bus ride to the hub of the city's nightlife. Overall we would recommend this hotel as a definite place to stay should you visit this city, we will certainly be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Tolerable”
Reviews.Author: Guest0987
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a few steps from subway station Vittorio Emmanuele on the 5th floor of a huge building and very easy to find. You have to ring the bell to get the door open. Our double room was surprisingly spacios but bathroom was very simple. We were not disturbed with any noise at all. There were two extra pilliows and two extra blankets in the room. Also there was an moblile cooling conditioner (which we didn't use). Breakfast room was never crowded. You'll find a standart breakfast in it with the automatic coffee-machine. Cornflakes, muesli, yogurt, croissants, bread, jam, cheese, fruit compote: like in most 3* in Rome. We paid 70 euro/day for a double room which I consider to be an adequate price.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, and clean”
Reviews.Author: avva
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in Rome staying at the Orazia hotel. Booked the hotel through British Airways and paid extra to stay there. Read about the lift and location just before we left. On arrival huge wooden doors and an intercom. Then up in what we called the tardis an ancient lift wire caged with wooden doors. Reception the guy could have been a bit more friendly, room huge, with massive wardrobes, huge double bed, spotlessly clean. View of Sqaure and flower sellers. Breakfast more than adequate, pastries, cheese meat, rolls jam and more. Very peaceful hotel. Location at first we wondered, but its okay, a supermarket just down the road selling nice pastires and all you need. A block away turn left there is a small pizzaria very reasonable with lovely pizza, lasanga and more. Metro station on door step. 10 min walk from the termini for trains to airport. 25 mins from the collisium and Roman forums. We too went out at night and were fine did not feel at all in any danger. Not the place we would have choosen if we knew the hotel was on the fith floor, but it worked out well for us, and we enjoyed our stay at the Oriazia. Don't book the Rome hop on bus ( green) bit of a rip off, use the metro buy a two day ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Happy at Hotel Orazia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although located on the 5th floor, this was no problem, at all, there is a lift. The hotel staff were VERY welcoming, friendly and helpful with finding our way around, best times to visit etc. reminding us about security. The hotel entrance is only a few feet into Via Buonarroti and is just round the corner from the Vittorio red metro line, easily connecting to the other metro lines. Hotel Orazia is within easy walking distance of the beautiful S. Maria Maggiore and if you like walking, the Colliseum. One stop away on the metro takes you to Termini and the number 110 open-top bus route, a great 2-hour ride round all the main sites. You can hop on and off the bus around the route. The area around the hotel is busy and friendly and as two older women, we felt quite comfortable walking back in the evenings. There was no kettle/hospitality tray in the room, but this seems to be general in Europe, and you can order tea/coffee via room service and the reception staff will give you hot water if you ask for it. Enjoy your stay at this hotel, we certainly did.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kippercatSurreyUk
Reviews.Content: The Orazia is in a side street off the Victor Emmannuel Square, on the fifth floor of a rather anonymous building.Do not be put off by the entrance!The square has a faded grandeur and a lively feel, with clothes, flower and shoe stalls late into the night, even a tarot reader.Lots of local life and colour. Pharmacist and supermarket within 2 mins walk, and the metro could not be nearer. We did not feel unsafe at any time. Our room was huge, with a marble floor and massive repro furniture. It overlooked the square, with a pleasant view over trees, etc. The bathroom was a good size, with a full length bath with shower attachment, basin, loo and bidet. Although there was traffic noise from the square, the hotel itself was very quiet. All areas of the hotel were very clean and well maintained, but the most striking thing was the friendliness and efficiency of the staff. The guys in reception always greeted us by name, gave us loads of help in, eg, how to buy metro tickets, booked restauarants and a limo to the airport, and even wished my partner Happy Birthday (they must have looked in his passport!) We would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good value,friendly, comfortable base while in Rome

Reviews.Title: “good, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is just 10 min walk from the Terminal & 2 min to the U-Bahn.The area is a little busy but the rooms are very quiet. The staff are very helpful. The rooms are very good.........it looked like as if they were all newly furnished and most important they were kept clean. The rates are also reasonable. We had it booked by a travel agency. The beakfast is a little simple but deifnately healthy and hygenic. The lift is a little like the old times..............but the hotel is very well modrenised and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms and rude reception”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Coming to this hotel was a terrible experience - so bad, in fact, we made a decision to check out early after only a few hours. The hotel is located on the fourth and fifth floors of a dark, dungenous building, with dim lights and a cramped elevator. The area of town, we later learned, was not the safest location in Rome. Upon arrival to the Orazia the man behind the desk prolonged a personal phone call while my friend and I waited at least 7 minutes to even be acknowledged. The room we were given had filthy dirty walls and the shower flooded while turned on and took 15 minutes to drain. When my friend and I complained to the reception desk, the man was rude, offered no solutions for us and generally did not seem to care for our well being. We felt unsafe in this hotel and would not recommend this place to anyone. I have never been to a hotel and been treated so poorly and rudely, particularly at a place that deems themselves 3-stars. There are much much better places to stay at in Rome for cheaper - this place is not worth your time or your money.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Orazia
HotelInfo.Address: Buonarroti, 51, 00185 Rome, Italy
